alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 4:32PM PDT until August 25 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 557 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues just west of Borrego Springs. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 557 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and dry washes areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Grapevine Canyon and Pinyon Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Banner and S2, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 and Borrego Springs Rd, Borrego Springs, Ranchita, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita and Borrego Springs, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Warner Springs and Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel and Warner Springs. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
